verses.verse: (Maskil of David, when he was in the cave. A Prayer.) I cry <S%H2199><s%> aloud <S%H2199><s%> with my voice <S%H6963><s%> to the Lord; <S%H3068><s%> I make <S%H2603><s%> supplication <S%H2603><s%> with my voice <S%H6963><s%> to the Lord. <S%H3068><s%>
I pour <S%H8210><s%> out my complaint <S%H7879><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> Him; I declare <S%H5046><s%> my trouble <S%H6869><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> Him.

When my spirit <S%H7307><s%> was overwhelmed <S%H5848><s%> within <S%H5921><s%> me, Thou didst know <S%H3045><s%> my path. <S%H9350><s%> In the way <S%H734><s%> where <S%H2098><s%> I walk <S%H1980><s%> They have hidden <S%H2934><s%> a trap <S%H6341><s%> for me.

Look <S%H5027><s%> to the right <S%H3225><s%> and see; <S%H7200><s%> For there <S%H369><s%> is no <S%H369><s%> one <S%H369><s%> who regards <S%H5234><s%> me; There is no escape <S%H6><s%> for me; No <S%H4498><s%> one <S%H369><s%> cares <S%H369><s%> for my soul. <S%H1875><s%>
I cried <S%H2199><s%> out to Thee, O Lord; <S%H3068><s%> I said, <S%H559><s%> "Thou art my refuge, <S%H4268><s%> My portion <S%H2506><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%> of the living. <S%H2416><s%>

"Give <S%H7181><s%> heed <S%H7181><s%> to my cry, <S%H7440><s%> For I am brought <S%H1809><s%> very <S%H3966><s%> low; <S%H1809><s%> Deliver <S%H5337><s%> me from my persecutors, <S%H7291><s%> For they are too <S%H4480><s%> strong <S%H553><s%> for me.

"Bring <S%H3318><s%> my soul <S%H5315><s%> out of prison, <S%H4525><s%> So that I may give <S%H3034><s%> thanks <S%H3034><s%> to Thy name; <S%H8034><s%> The righteous <S%H6662><s%> will surround <S%H3803><s%> me, For Thou wilt deal <S%H1580><s%> bountifully <S%H1580><s%> with me."
